intro: Metrosideros pendens, commonly known as the weeping pohutukawa, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its drooping, bright red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, woody fruits that contain seeds. It typically grows in coastal areas and is well adapted to salt spray and strong winds. The weeping pohutukawa is a culturally significant tree in New Zealand, often associated with the Māori people.
